mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Pio, Chevalier
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Difficult circumstances force him to give lessons in Italian; had to renounce his service to the King of Naples during the revolution because he was opposed to Mr. de Circello, former ambassador and now prime minister in Naples; Circello refused to recommend him to the Duchess of Orleans, niece of Ferdinand IV; asks Jefferson for news and any orders he may have.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
Ferdinand II, King of the Two Sicilies, 1810-1859
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1816 August 29, Rue St. Honore, Paris, [France] to [Thomas Jefferson], n.p.
